result.execSummary:
The defendant Tharis Quinn Watson Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to be paid.
Parties stipulate to restitution in the amount of $883.00 payable to the Milwaukee County District Attorney's Office.
Court ordered a payment plan in the amount of $20.00 per month with the first payment due on 1-15-2015 and additional payments due the 15th of each month thereafter. If there are any missed payments, remaining balance will be due FORTHWITH and an immediate entry of a civil judgment is ordered by the court. Court orders restitution to be paid in full first before any payments are applied to court costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any sentence, straight time, and with credit for 137 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.
**1/23/2015  Release privileges granted for medical release.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tharis Quinn Watson Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tharis Quinn Watson not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DEFENDANT IS DECEASED.
ANY FINE/FORFEITURES, COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES TO BE WAIVED.
ANY OUTSTANDING CIVIL JUDGMENTS, FINE & COST COMMITMENTS, SUSPENSIONS FOR DRIVING PRIVILEGES TO BE VACATED AND/OR WITHDRAWN.
Deceased 9/12/16

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.

Order, signed and filed.
The defendant's request for privileges is granted. Defendant may be released for the following: medical release.
Copies mailed to parties.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Carolina Stark, Branch 17, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for medical release privileges and release on electronic monitoring.
See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP.

Defendant Tharis Quinn Watson in court with attorney Michael William Lutz.  Defendant Tharis Quinn Watson in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNT 1 - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
Court ordered defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; straight time; credit for 137 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 

- Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to be paid. 
- Parties stipulate to restitution in the amount of $883.00 payable to the Milwaukee County District Attorneys Office. 
  Court ordered a payment plan in the amount of $20.00 per month with the first payment due on 1-15-2015 and additional payments due the 15th of each
  month thereafter.  If there are any missed payments any remaining balance will be due FORTHWITH and an immediate entry of a civil judgment is ordered by
  the court.  Court orders restitution to be paid in full first before any monthly payments are applied to court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges. 

-Defendant to provide a DNA sample, if not already done. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
from Defendant written pro-se, received and filed.

Defendant Tharis Quinn Watson in court with attorney Donald Crawford Dudley.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case is held off the record. Defense requests the case be set for Plea and Sentencing. Case is adjourned for Plea and Sentencing on 12-11-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael William Lutz in court, defendant Tharis Quinn Watson not in court, in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case heard off the record. For the reasons presented to the Court the case is adjourned for Scheduling Conference on 10-30-2014 at 8:30 a.m. Br. 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Donald Crawford Dudley in court, defendant Tharis Quinn Watson not in court, in custody.  Danielle Chojnacki for Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Status of Counsel Hearing.
Defense motions the Court for bail modification. Arguments heard. Court denies the Defense motion to modify bail. 
Defense requests case be set for Scheduling Conference. Court orders case adjourned for Scheduling Conference on 10-10-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17. 
  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant.  Case adjourned for status of counsel in branch 17.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tharis Quinn Watson in court with attorney Michael William Lutz via telephone.  Defendant Tharis Quinn Watson in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail/Bond Hearing proceeds. Defense and State heard. Court denies the Defense bail reduction motion.  Hearing scheduled for October 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jason Canfield for Attorney Michael William Lutz in court, defendant Tharis Quinn Watson not in court, in custody.  Danielle Chojnacki for Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Bail Bond Hearing. At the request of the Defense the Court is not taking action on motion for bail reduction. Court orders case adjourned for Motion Hearing 9-23-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Reduction filed pro-se, received.

Defendant Tharis Quinn Watson in court with attorney Michael William Lutz.  Defendant Tharis Quinn Watson in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.   No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed, no drug paraphernalia and no alcohol.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant is not to travel outside of the State of Wisconsin while the case is pending. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Attorney Michael William Lutz in court, defendant Tharis Quinn Watson not in court, in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Return on Warrant. 
Court addresses bail. Arguments heard. 
Court orders case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing on 9-5-2014 at 1:30 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Bench warrant served. Original in Court file.
Defendant/Surety's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bail/bond forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($1,000.00 signature bond) ad
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 1000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Daryl A Kastenson in court.  Paul Hauer for Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tharis Quinn Watson in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Marissa L Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
